revised_title: The Influence of Temperature, Density, and Chemical Composition on the Electric Conductivity of Glass
tldr: This paper presents the results of experiments on the relationship between the electric conductivity of glass and its density and chemical composition. The author finds that the conductivity is lowest when the glass is an exact chemical compound and that the conductivity may increase with time. The study also reveals a marked connection between electric conductivity and density in lead or flint glass.
